alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 20 at 12:07PM MDT until October 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with some areas receiving greater than 12 inches, especially the Upper Cottonwoods. * WHERE...Wasatch Back, Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains and Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through late Sunday night, with the heaviest snow expected Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Snow will result in periods of travel difficulties, especially for seasonal routes that are still open. Backcountry access will become treacherous and should be taken into consideration for hikers, hunters, and other recreators.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains
